name: Save Settings in Template
title: Save Settings in Template
body:
Overview

This article explains how to save settings in a template for survey projects, allowing users to reuse layout configurations in future surveys efficiently.

 

Information

Learn how to save your project layout settings as a template, which can be easily applied to future surveys with similar layouts.

 

  • Saving Settings in a Template
  • Layout Generations

 

Saving Settings in a Template

To save your project layout settings as a template, follow these steps:

Step 1

Navigate to the Layout menu.

Step 2

Select Save settings in template.

Step 3

Choose to either overwrite an existing template or create a new one.

Step 4

Provide a name and description for the template to help with future identification and organization.

 

Layout Generations

From EFS 10.0, layout settings are closely tied to the selected layout generation. There are two types of layout generations:

  • Responsive layout
  • Traditional system layout

When saving settings, the layout generation of the current project will also be saved. It's important to note that the new template can only be used in projects of the appropriate generation.

 

FAQ

Can I use a saved template for any project?

No, saved templates are specific to the layout generation (responsive or traditional) of the project in which they were created. You can only use a template in projects with the same layout generation.

How do I apply a saved template to a new project?

When creating a new survey project, you can select the saved template and assign it to the project during the setup process.
